<<<<<<< HEAD
The disputes between Mr. Cranford, and Dr. Chamberlen. At the house of Mr. William Webb, at the end of Bartholomew Lane, by the Old Exchange: on March 1. 1652, and April 1. 6. 13. / Published for the satisfaction of all that love the truth. Cranford, James, d. 1657. Chamberlen, Peter, 1601-1683.
[6], 28 [i.e. 30], [4] p.
Printed by Gartrude Dawson, and are to be sold by Gyles Calvert at the Black Spread-Eagle near the west end of Paules, London : 1652.
P. 29, 30 misnumbered 62, 28. Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 8". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[6], 28 [i.e. 30], [4] p.
Printed by Gartrude Dawson, and are to be sold by Gyles Calvert at the Black Spread-Eagle near the west end of Paules, London : 1652.
P. 29, 30 misnumbered 62, 28. Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 8". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
